title: FTSE LIVE: Hong Kong suitor drops bid for LSE; Easyjet to profit from rivals' woes
text:
Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing has dropped its £32billion pursuit of the London Stock Exchange Group, curbing its audacious attempt to create a global markets giant.

The offer reportedly failed to win over the LSE board and was described by one market expert as a 'non starter'.

Meanwhile, budget airline Easyjet said it benefited in the past three months from the strike disruption at rival airlines Ryanair and British Airways. Its profits for the year are expected to be in the top end of its forecasts.

The FTSE 100 has nudged up a touch at the open as its slow rebound from last week's rout continues. For the time being US-China trade tensions and Brexit remain very much in focus.
